conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graphs for both objects to determine if the difference in speed is continuously increasing.
Graph A shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and increases to a peak velocity before decreasing back to a lower velocity.
The peak velocity of object A is higher than the initial velocity, indicating that the speed of object A is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
Graph B shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and decreases to a lower velocity before increasing back to a higher velocity.
The peak velocity of object B is lower than the initial velocity, indicating that the speed of object B is continuously decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
The difference in speed between the two objects, A and B, is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
